Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [humming] What the hell? No. This is NOT happening.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Didn't you get the memo? It's Stairmageddon! [claps and opens the door to the stairwell] Come on Stanley! [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight is having maintenance done on the elevator today, and he was really on top of it. Weeks ago, he started the Stairmageddon Awareness campaign. The idea was to get us prepared, both mentally and physically, for a day that hopefully comes once in a 100 years. It's a... "Mageddon!"

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Come on! Come on, Stanley! Stay in it!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [growls] I put 17 damn years into this company, and now they're making me climb Stair Mountain!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Come on! [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Our office has an unusually large number of... unusually large people.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This is an abomination.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Come on. You got this. Here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So when something as routine as elevator maintenance happens, and people are forced to expend cardiovascular effort, we have to compare it to the end of time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Red alert! Red alert! The reviews are in! I repeat, the reviews are in.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just got a text from my brother. Scranton Times Tribune.com. There's a review of the documentary!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [gasps] What does it say?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know, Phyllis! I just got the text and started screaming, "Red Alert."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, the alert was already set to "Red" because of Stairmageddon. You think I should set it to "Double Red"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think we should.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [drinks a 5-Hour Energy shot and groans]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: "The Office: An American Workplace airing on PBS next month is a documentary following the employees of Scranton's own Dunder Mifflin Paper Company!"

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Whoo! [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: "In this series, which will air starting in May, we get an in-depth look at many interesting local people. There's Kevin Malone, the falstaffian accountant. Dwight Schrute, the head salesman forever chasing a manager position he will never get."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does Josh McAuliffe know about the paper business? He works for a news...thing.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: "Andy Bernard, the rudderless trust fund child-slash-middle manager, whose incompetence is emblematic of a declining American economy."

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ouch. Sorry, Andy, that's-.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's okay. [chuckles] The hell does he know?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: "A possible explanation for his lack of career focus is his surprising musical talent."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I want you to print that out for me.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I will.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now that this documentary is coming out, my days at Dunder Mifflin are probably limited. And you know what? Good. Because this is not what I wanted to do with my life. I wanted to be my generation's Lisa Loeb.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: "Though it mostly focuses on the daily realities of office life, a lurid subplot reveals the hypocrisy of a local public figure embroiled in a gay affair while preaching family values."

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh! Which public figure?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I bet it's Katie Couric. I've been saying this for years.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, I think they mean more like a politician.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [walks into the office grunting and wheezing] You own the building. Why can't you fix the elevator in the middle of the night? Who do I look like? Jackie Joyner-Kersee?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I did say it would be an inconvenience. You should have called me from downstairs. We could've met in the lobby. It's time to go out on a sale! Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Son, you've lost your mind. I'm not going anywhere until you fix my elevator.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The buyer is your sister's friend. This is the printing paper for the entire school district of Lackawanna. You are coming, and that's an order.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You are not my damn boss and you never will be! Guess what? Never gonna happen! Pete! Iced tea. Three sugars, five creams.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Your morning 3-by-5. Coming right up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, we won't be late. I love you, mom. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, your mom's watching the kids tonight. So what are you two up to? [chuckles] Oh, um, Embassy Suites. "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. Mommy and Daddy are on the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] I wish.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [chuckles] What, then?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing that exciting.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Marriage counseling?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Did you know that is the only kind of counseling I have never had?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, Jim's kind of nervous about it, but I think it could really help.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, we've having issues. It can't hurt to talk about them, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Toby. Um, I wanted to ask you a question.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a little, uh, personal.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Let's do it. Let's get personal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wanted to talk to you about your divorce.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry. I--no, no, no, what I meant--what I meant actually was--

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, no, it's okay. I can handle it. Um, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You guys obviously went through some tough times leading up to it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [chuckles, snorts]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I was wondering if you ever did any couple's counseling.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, sure, lots of times. Yeah. Wait, you and Pam aren't in couple's counseling, are you? Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. Uh, we're just starting couple's counseling. Uh, which doesn't sound any better.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, you guys. Kelly called it. 2013. So s--hey! Hey! Hey, no! No! Get outta here. Clark, get outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: My mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes, it is your mistake. He's lingering. So annoying. I'm gonna kill him. How can I help? I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello, William Morris Agency. I need to speak with your best agent who represents your biggest stars. Yes, I'll hold. I'm sorry. I misunderstood. Goodbye. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you, Stan. Oh, honey. [Stan closes limo door] Look, I just want our life to get back to normal. Ribbon cuttings, charity balls.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Don't worry. I've scheduled a press conference for later today. We just need to face the camera together. A beloved public servant and his devoted wife. And move on.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: All right, if I have to be the good wife, I'll be the best damn wife there is. Correction. Best darn wife. Sorry, I'm a better wife than that. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy--[knocks] I need to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, come on in. I'm just on hold with another talent agency. It's insane. This promo with me playing banjo has 250 views already. And every time I click, there's more. 251. 252. I can't even keep up!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley is refusing to go out on a sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [grunts intensely] I hate people! Why do they never do what you need them to do? Stanley has to go. That's final.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what I'm hearing you say is, "Make Stanley go out on the sales call by whatever means possible"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! I'm sorry I'm being curt, it's just I'm about to land a top talent agent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Directory? Movie Star department. Back. Directory.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For five years I've held my instincts in check because I wanted to be made manager. Maybe it's time for me to just let that thought go. It's kind of painful, but it's also freeing in a way. Now it's all about my instincts.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley, one way or another, you are gonna come with me to make this sale.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, c-c-can you just let me out of here before whatever comes next?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't worry, it's just a bull tranquilizer. Nothing to be alarmed about. It's just a man pointing a bull tranquilizer at a coworker.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Dwight, you do not learn, do you? For a threat to be credible, you ha--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [fires tranquilizer gun at Stanley]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Holy [bleep].

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, you didn't. Sick of you and your--ooh--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [fires tranquilizer gun twice]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [falls to the floor with a loud thud]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's all right. Andy approved it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Man, he's really in twinkle town now.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Is he gonna be okay? I mean, weren't those darts intended for an animal, like, two to three times larger than him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, this dosage was meant for a very small bull, and Stanley's got way more body fat than they do.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You gave him three shots.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shh. Got about 45 minutes to get him to the client before he comes to. [claps] Grab his feet. [grunts] Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Move it! One, two, three. [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's like a manatee. Ready? Let's go again. Come on. We can do this. One, two, three! [Stanley's head hits the door frame] Oh, God. No wonder my elevator cables are under such strain.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: We gotta get a wheelbarrow or something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grunts] Okay, we're good. We're good. Let's go. Push!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I am!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Any good weekend plans?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I might see a movie.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about you?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't know yet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grunts] Let's take him--

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I was thinking about...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go right to the top of the stairs, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: And then what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, listen. I'm kind of embarrassed to admit this, but I've never actually done this before.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, if I may, you're a natural.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. I mean, I've rehearsed it in my head like 1,000 times, but, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: That's a little weird.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. Evel Knievel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [wraps tape around Stanley's body]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [connect helmet straps around Stanley's head] That's about as good as that's gonna be.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, now here's the plan. I'm gonna launch him. I need you to go to the bottom and catch him.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Catch?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I can't catch him. He's like, 250 pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You use your hands and just blunt his descent, okay? He's gonna be moving slowly. It's only--

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Blunt?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's 15 feet down, it's at a 45-degree angle. Get set in your haunches, it's like your catching a medicine--

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Dude, this size of my haunches-- [Stanley's body slips down the stairs and his head thumps into a wall]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Good call. He would have put a hole in your chest same as he put a hole in that wall.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: We should probably call a doctor or something, dude.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [slides down the stairs and lands next to Stanley] You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So how does it work? It's like, you know, the action of talking to a third party breaks up the log jam, or...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You're really there to talk to each other. I would say that the therapist is more of a facilitator.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He might start by asking each of you, "Why do you think you're here?"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He took this job in Philly without telling me. He bought our house without telling me. At a certain point, he shouldn't be rewarded for that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If I didn't do certain things without telling Pam, she'd be married to Roy. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel like he's always making these decisions for the family, and then I'm left playing catch-up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If she can just hang on for a little while longer, I--this will be so huge for our family.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, what's a little while?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I mean, what's the end date? It must be really hard for her to sign on to be unhappy if she doesn't know when it's gonna end.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's kind of an impossible question.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, guys, it's starting! Hurry!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, there's Angela! I work with her!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Huh, yeah. [chuckles] I mean, I'm happy Angela's the first one getting famous, but it's a little weird, no? I mean, she can't sing or act, so it's actually kind of insane, if you think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Her hair looks beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, we get it, Phyllis, she looks like a freakin' movie star! [kicks trash can]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [on the computer screen] I would just to start by saying that there have been some rumors about my personal life that I would like to settle once and for all. As my long-suffering wife can attest... I am gay.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [surprised chatter]

Quote.Speaker: Reporter #1
Quote.Text: Senator, were always gay, or did your wife turn you gay?

Quote.Speaker: Reporter #2
Quote.Text: Question for the Senator's beard.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [on the computer screen] I'll say it again for mis amigos latinos. Yo soy homosexual.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Poor Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah. Poor Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I once believed that a gay person could be somewhat straight. It wasn't until my marriage to Angela that I realized how...charmless I find the female body.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oof. Always hurts to hear that one.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: There's someone else I need to thank. His name is Oscar Martinez.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oscar is the one who opened my eyes to who I really am. For the first time--

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oscar is with the Senator too?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! And I knew it the whole time! I kept the secret. I kept the secret so good. You didn't know, you didn't know, and you didn't freaking know. But I knew! [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He knew!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes, we did it!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You did it, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! Ohh! I did it. Ohh, I did it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: -with this new self-awareness, I was finally able to find love at long last. With my amazing... Chief of Staff Wesley Silver.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Wesley Silver's gay?

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [surprised chatter]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: They make a nice couple.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [gags]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Almost there. Almost there. [opens car door] Okay. We're running late. Let's get him inside.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: We can't just leave him bubble wrapped like this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? The bubble wrap is the only thing that's stopping his suit from getting wrinkled. These meetings are all about presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: That's actually really smart.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: God, if only there was any other use or situation for that kind of knowledge.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get him inside.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Carla Fern is not just an actor's agent. She does writers, directors, travel, and real estate.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Actor?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Oh, no. [chuckles] Well, I have an act. Dog, cat, mouse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, wow, cool. Is it hard to train them to do that?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Eh, you go through a lot of mice.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: If started by accident as these things tend to do. You know, I was setting down my cat, and I accidently put her on top of my dog, and I was, like, so mad at myself at first. And then I was, like, wait. Wait a second.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does anything go on top of the mouse?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Yeah. Little hat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aw, that's cute.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's the mouse's name?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Eh, you know, it really doesn't make sense to name the mice. They're kinda like cannon fodder, you know? You're not one of those PETA guys , are you? [cat jumps off dog] Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, wait, wait, how--how are we doing this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I'll grab the forelegs, and you push his hindquarters.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Just say "arms" and "legs," okay? That just--that's the vernacular that I'm comfortable with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine, let's go. [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hoist his shank on three.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Wha--What's a shank?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's by the tenderloin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Roll him, roll him, roll him. Good. Good. Okay, careful, he's slouching. Okay, can you--sl-slouch him into the seat. [sighs] Here. Here. Go around and get his seatbelt. [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah--yup yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grunts and closes car door] Get in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Aw, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, Stanley? Do you understand what we're about to do?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Helllloooo!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Okay. We, hey--hey, listen, listen. We are going to go discuss paper contracts for city of Lackawanna public schools, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Pigeons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, God, this is bad. Looks like we've got no choice. You, my friend, are going to have to be Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Isn't the client, like, best friends with his sister?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: New plan, okay? We get him a cup of coffee and we go back to the old plan. Let's go! Gimme a hand. Here we go. Come on, Stanley! Here we go. Upsie-doozie. There we go. Okay, all right. Come on, big guy. You can walk, right? Yeah. What a pretty smile. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sure Athlead will be a huge success. But I don't want him to do it anymore, and I don't want to give him an ultimatum, but I am not moving our family to Philly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, if Pam says she won't go, then--[chuckles] we're gonna need a lot more than counseling. Hmph.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That was exhausting.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Blah blah blah blah. Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, they deserve each other, then.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: They do. That they do.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That is for sure.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [whispers] That they do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And for--oh, whoopsie daisy. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Davis
Quote.Text: Stanley, what is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's fine. He gets carsick really easily.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Driving.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a long drive. He was in the backseat. But right now we're talking to Mrs. Davis about the full range of the products that we offer and our competitive rates, right, Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ooh-hoo, look at that baby...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ohhh...

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Davis
Quote.Text: That's Benji in the middle.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's Benji. Oh, he's precious. That's a healthy-looking baby.

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Davis
Quote.Text: Very special little boy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at him. I've never seen such a beautiful child.

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Davis
Quote.Text: Funny sense of humor. If you push on his nose, he'll go, "eee."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like this? Watch.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Eee.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Davis
Quote.Text: Like that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A beautiful family.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] Right? Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, maybe I'll never be manager, but I just managed to get our most stubborn salesman to close a sale with one of our biggest clients, and I must say, it's the most pleasant I've ever seen Stanley. I think we should consider injecting him with bull tranquilizer on a daily basis.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: So, what can you do?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Australian accent] Well, what can't I do? Right, I can sing, I can dance, I can play the banjo, innit? And if you hadn't noticed, I've got a pretty good British accent.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Can you drive a car?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: At the risk of sounding arrogant, I did drive myself here.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Why do you have, uh, a high school musical here on your resume? What are you, like, 40? 45?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My exact age is 28 to 34, so basically just send me out on whatever Jake Gyllenhaal's going out on.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Gyllenhaal, got it. Can you juggle and crap?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: : Yes. And yes. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Would you dress up as, say, a birthday clown and go to a kid's party, let 'em throw pies at ya?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whereas that is not why I have entered show business, I do understand that you have to build credibility. [sniffs] I'm all for it.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Well, Mr. Bernard, I'm gonna be honest with you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, at least I tried. Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: Uh, no. We're--we're gonna take you on as a client.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You are? Yes! Yes. Are you being for real right now? Oh, man. Ah, yes! I need this so bad. I really think this is what could fix me.

Quote.Speaker: Carla
Quote.Text: We are extremely excited to be working with you too, sir. Pay Todd on your way out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Most talent agents take 10% of whatever jobs they get you, but with Carla you pay a flat rate of $5,000 up front. And that includes headshots.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: Uh, it doesn't include headshots.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It doesn't include headshots.

Quote.Speaker: Todd
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, of course not, because that would be insane if it did. Still getting a bargain, though.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So I just smiled and complimented her grandkids, and we closed it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You earned yourself a nice, fat commission and you didn't even know it. I'll go tell Andy the good news. Oh. [chuckles] Silly me. Gotta take the stairs.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I'm not doing that again. You got me down, you gotta get me back up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well--no, no--n--

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [stabs his own leg with a tranquilizer dart and falls to the ground]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [stomps on the ground] We need a winch and a hoist.
